Posts.Content: Jun 22, 2009 01:05AM ladysmith105 wrote: I don't like laying in the sun for hours like my husband does but I really enjoy swimming; we have a 16 x 32' inground pool in our back yard that will remain closed this summer.  I also love the beach and swimming in the ocean.  I love snorkeling and other water sports.  We inherited a condo in Florida from my in-laws when they passed; its right across the street from a private beach.  We drive from NJ to FL 2 to 3 times a year for an inexpensive vacation while paying for my childrens college education (we rent it out a few months to make it affordable).  I do love the feel of the sun after swimming in the ocean or pool, and love the way a tan makes you look and feel.  I am one week into my RT.  If I can no longer enjoy going out to the beach or swimming in my pool I don't have much to look forward to.  I will find a way to do it by applying spf 100 to my chest, and buying a swimsut that has a higher neckline (after at least 1 yr) & stay under the umbella as much as possible.  Many times I thought I would just refuse the radiation, and there are still moments were I want to quit, but like you said the whole point is survival.  I wish you the best with your radiation.
